org.matrix.olm

Class OlmOutboundGroupSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.olm.CommonSerializeUtils
      • org.matrix.olm.OlmOutboundGroupSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class OlmOutboundGroupSession
extends CommonSerializeUtils
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used to create an outbound a Megolm session.
    To send a first message in an encrypted room, the client should start a new outbound Megolm session. The session ID and the session key must be shared with each device in the room within.

    Detailed implementation guide is available at Implementing End-to-End Encryption in Matrix clients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createNewSessionJni

        private long createNewSessionJni()
        Create the corresponding OLM outbound group session in native side.
        An exception is thrown if the operation fails. Do not forget to call releaseSession() when JAVA side is done.
        Returns:
        native session instance identifier (see mNativeId)

      • releaseSession

        public void releaseSession()
        Release native session and invalid its JAVA reference counter part.
        Public API for releaseSessionJni().

      • releaseSessionJni

        private void releaseSessionJni()
        Destroy the corresponding OLM outbound group session native object.
        This method must ALWAYS be called when this JAVA instance is destroyed (ie. garbage collected) to prevent memory leak in native side. See createNewSessionJni().

      • isReleased

        public boolean isReleased()
        Return true the object resources have been released.
        Returns:
        true the object resources have been released

      • messageIndex

        public int messageIndex()
        Get the current message index for this session.
        Each message is sent with an increasing index, this method returns the index for the next message.
        Returns:
        current session index

      • messageIndexJni

        private int messageIndexJni()
        Get the current message index for this session.
        Each message is sent with an increasing index, this method returns the index for the next message. An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Returns:
        current session index

      • sessionKey

        public java.lang.String sessionKey()
                            throws OlmException
        Get the base64-encoded current ratchet key for this session.
        Each message is sent with a different ratchet key. This method returns the ratchet key that will be used for the next message.
        Returns:
        outbound session key
        Throws:
        OlmException - the failure reason

      • sessionKeyJni

        private byte[] sessionKeyJni()
        Return the session key. An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Returns:
        the session key

      • serialize

        protected byte[] serialize(byte[] aKey,
                           java.lang.StringBuffer aErrorMsg)
        Return the current outbound group session as a base64 byte buffers.
        The session is serialized and encrypted with aKey. In case of failure, an error human readable description is provide in aErrorMsg.
        Specified by:
        serialize in class CommonSerializeUtils
        Parameters:
        aKey - encryption key
        aErrorMsg - error message description
        Returns:
        pickled base64 bytes buffer if operation succeed, null otherwise

      • serializeJni

        private byte[] serializeJni(byte[] aKey)
        JNI counter part of serialize(byte[], StringBuffer). An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Parameters:
        aKey - encryption key
        Returns:
        the serialized session

      • deserialize

        protected void deserialize(byte[] aSerializedData,
                           byte[] aKey)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads an account from a pickled base64 string.
        See serialize(byte[], StringBuffer)
        Specified by:
        deserialize in class CommonSerializeUtils
        Parameters:
        aSerializedData - pickled account in a base64 bytes buffer
        aKey - key used to encrypted
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • deserializeJni

        private long deserializeJni(byte[] aSerializedData,
                            byte[] aKey)
        Allocate a new session and initialize it with the serialisation data.
        An exception is thrown if the operation fails.
        Parameters:
        aSerializedData - the session serialisation buffer
        aKey - the key used to encrypt the serialized account data
        Returns:
        the deserialized session
